Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: First, the temporal profile is a dictionary with keys as tuples of activity pairs, and values as (avg_time, std_dev) in seconds.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Defining Temporal Profile - The temporal profile is structured as a dictionary with keys as tuples representing pairs of activities. - Values in the dictionary are tuples containing the average time and standard deviation, measured in seconds.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Listing Activities - Key activities include Supplier Selection (SS), Order Placement (OP), and Receive (RC). - These activities form the pairs used as keys in the temporal profile dictionary.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Expanding Activity List - New activities include Quality Inspection (QI), Component Assembly (CA), Product Testing (PT), Packaging (PK), Warehouse Storage (WS), Distribution (DT), and After-Sales Support (AS). - These activities expand the possible pairs in the temporal profile, covering more supply chain stages.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Generating Pairs - For a trace like A,B,C,D, all pairs such as (A,B), (A,C), (A,D), (B,C), (B,D), and (C,D) are considered, not just consecutive ones. - This approach ensures complexity by including pairs separated by multiple steps in the process.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Estimating Times - Need to estimate average times and standard deviations for these pairs, as no explicit numerical data is provided. - Estimates will be based on real-world supply chain knowledge, with times in seconds (e.g., 86400 s = 1 day, 3600 s = 1 hour).
